original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A fool is quick-tempered, but a wise person stays clam_

_when insulted. _(Pro. 12:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When someone annoys or insults you, it is natural to

retaliate. But this solves nothing and only encourages

trouble, instead answer slowly and quietly. Your

response will achieve positive results. Pro. 15:1 says,

"A gentle answer turns away wrath."

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me for loosing control when I have

been annoyed by someone. Amen.
original_reflection_text: When someone annoys or insults you, it is natural to retaliate. But this solves nothing and only encourages trouble, instead answer slowly and quietly. Your response will achieve positive results. Proverbs 15:1 says, "A gentle answer turns away wrath. "
original_verse_text: A fool is quick-tempered, but a wise person stays clam when insulted.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to heed the counsel of Your Word, which teaches us to respond with gentleness and patience when faced with provocation. Grant us the self-control to resist the urge to retaliate, and instead, to answer slowly and quietly, that we may diffuse conflict and encourage peace. May our responses reflect Your love and grace, bringing glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: When someone annoys or insults you, it is natural to retaliate. But this solves nothing and only encourages trouble, instead answer slowly and quietly. Your response will achieve positive results. Proverbs 15:1 says, "A gentle answer turns away wrath. "
subject: Gentle Answers Diffuse Conflict
verse_text: A fool is quick-tempered, but a wise person stays clam when insulted.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Truth stands the test of time; lies are soon exposed,_ (Pro. 12:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Truth is always timely, it applies today and in the future. Because
it

is connected with God's changeless character, IT is also changeless.

Think for a moment about the centuries that have passed since these

proverbs were written. Consider the countless hours that have been

carefully spent studding every sentence of Scriptures. The Bible has

withstood the test of time. Because God is truth, you can trust His

Word to guide you.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word which is

the same yesterday, today, and for ever. I thank You that it

has withstood the test of time, and that it is a guiding light to

all who believe. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Truth is always timely, it applies today and in the future. Because it is connected with God's changeless character, IT is also changeless. Think for a moment about the centuries that have passed since these proverbs were written. Consider the countless hours that have been carefully spent studding every sentence of Scriptures. The Bible has withstood the test of time. Because God is truth, you can trust His Word to guide you.
original_verse_text: Truth stands the test of time; lies are soon exposed,
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your eternal and unchanging truth revealed in Your holy Word. Your Scriptures have stood the test of time, guiding generations with the light of Your timeless wisdom. Help us to cling to the truth of Your promises, for Your Word is the foundation of all that is right and good. Grant us discernment to distinguish truth from falsehood, and the courage to stand firm in Your ways. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Truth is always timely; it applies today and in the future. Because it is connected with God's changeless character, it is also changeless. Think for a moment about the centuries that have passed since these proverbs were written. Consider the countless hours that have been carefully spent studying every sentence of Scripture. The Bible has withstood the test of time. Because God is truth, you can trust His Word to guide you.
subject: Timeless Truths to Guide You
verse_text: Truth stands the test of time; lies are soon exposed,

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_No real harm befalls the godly, but the wicked have their _

_share of trouble. (Pro. 12:21)_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This is general, but not a universal truth. Although harm does

befall the godly, they are able to see opportunities in their

problems and move ahead. The wicked, without God's wisdom,

are ill-equipped to handle their problems.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for the benefits of wisdom, including

long life, wealth, honor, and peace. I thank You that when You

return the blessings that have been delayed will come into being.

So help me to live by believing and not by seeing. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This is general, but not a universal truth. Although harm does befall the godly, they are able to see opportunities in their problems and move ahead. The wicked, without God's wisdom, are ill-equipped to handle their problems.
original_verse_text: No real harm befalls the godly, but the wicked have their share of trouble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding, for Your ways are higher than our ways. When troubles arise, grant us the discernment to see the opportunities within, that we may walk the path You have set before us. May the wicked find their way to You, the source of all wisdom and understanding. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: This is general, but not a universal truth. Although harm does befall the godly, they are able to see opportunities in their problems and move ahead. The wicked, without God's wisdom, are ill-equipped to handle their problems.
subject: Godly Embrace Opportunities in Adversity
verse_text: No real harm befalls the godly, but the wicked have their share of trouble.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The Lord hates those who do not keep their word, but He _

_delights in those who do. _(Pro. 12:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What is really being said here is, don't make promises to God

in heaven that you can't keep. So be sure to let your words be

few and true.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me remember to always be careful

when I make promises to You, and others. I pray that Your Spirit

would guide me in the truth so that I won't make promises I can't

keep. Amen.
original_reflection_text: What is really being said here is, don't make promises to God in heaven that you can't keep. So be sure to let your words be few and true.
original_verse_text: The Lord hates those who do not keep their word, but He delights in those who do.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and humility, acknowledging that our words and actions should align with Your will. Help us to be mindful of the promises we make, that they may be few and true, reflecting the sincerity of our hearts. May we speak with wisdom and discretion, ever mindful that You are a God of faithfulness and truth. Guide us to honor You with our words and deeds, that our lives may glorify Your name. Amen.
reflection: What is really being said here is, "Don't make promises to God in heaven that you can't keep." So be sure to let your words be few and true.
subject: Promises Kept, Words Few
verse_text: The Lord hates those who do not keep their word, but He delights in those who do.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Wise people don't make a show of their knowledge. But fools
broadcast_

_their folly _(Pro. 12:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wise people have a quiet confidence. Insecure or unstable people feel
the

need to prove themselves, but wise people don't have to prove
anything.

They know they are capable, so they can get on with their work.
Beware

of showing off. If you are modest, people may not notice you at
first, but

they will respect you latter.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a quiet confidence, so that I may
get

on with my work assured of the fact I have nothing to prove. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: Wise people have a quiet confidence. Insecure or unstable people feel the need to prove themselves, but wise people don't have to prove anything. They know they are capable, so they can get on with their work. Beware of showing off. If you are modest, people may not notice you at first, but they will respect you latter.
original_verse_text: Wise people don't make a show of their knowledge. But fools broadcast their folly.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking the wisdom that comes from You. Help us to be like the wise, who speak with quiet confidence, not needing to prove ourselves, but simply doing the work You have called us to do. May we be modest in our ways, not boastful or arrogant, but instead radiating the peace and assurance that comes from walking in Your ways. Guide us, Lord, to speak with grace and discernment, that we may bring honor to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Wise people have a quiet confidence. Insecure or unstable people feel the need to prove themselves, but wise people don't have to prove anything. They know they are capable, so they can get on with their work. Beware of showing off. If you are modest, people may not notice you at first, but they will respect you later.
subject: Quiet Confidence of the Wise
verse_text: Wise people don't make a show of their knowledge. But fools broadcast their folly.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Worry weighs a person down, an encouraging word _

_cheers a person up. _(Pro. 12:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The human spirit can endure a sick body, but who can

endure it if the spirit is crushed? Intelligent people are

always open to new ideas. In fact, they look for them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I am weighed

down by worries, for I know better because we are told

in Your Word to place our trust in You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The human spirit can endure a sick body, but who can endure it if the spirit is crushed? Intelligent people are always open to new ideas. In fact, they look for them.
original_verse_text: Worry weighs a person down, an encouraging word cheers a person up.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our spirits can endure even the greatest physical trials, but it is the state of our souls that truly matters. Lord, grant us the wisdom and discernment to be open to Your leading, to seek out new insights from Your Word, and to allow our spirits to be nourished by Your truth. May our hearts be filled with joy and our minds be receptive to the transformative power of Your Spirit. We trust in Your unfailing love and guidance. Amen.
reflection: The human spirit can endure a sick body, but who can endure it if the spirit is crushed? Intelligent people are always open to new ideas. In fact, they look for them.
subject: Enduring the Crushed Spirit
verse_text: Worry weighs a person down, an encouraging word cheers a person up.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The way of the godly leads to life; their path does not lead _

_to death. _(Pro. 12: 28)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Needless to say that death for many is a darkened door at the

end of life, a passage way to an unknown destiny. But for God's

people, death is a bright pathway to a new and better life. So

friends why do we fear death? Is it fear of pain we expect, the

separation from loved ones, or the unknown? God can help us

with those fears. He has shown us that death is not final but just

another step in the eternal life we received when we follow Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that we would always look at death as bright
pathway

to a better life, a life where there will be no more tears, suffering
or pain,

but a life of eternal bliss with You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Needless to say that death for many is a darkened door at the end of life, a passage way to an unknown destiny. But for God's people, death is a bright pathway to a new and better life. So friends why do we fear death? Is it fear of pain we expect, the separation from loved ones, or the unknown? God can help us with those fears. He has shown us that death is not final but just another step in the eternal life we received when we follow Him.
original_verse_text: The way of the godly leads to life; their path does not lead to death.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the promise of eternal life found in Your Word. Though we may walk through the valley of the shadow of death, we need not fear, for You are with us. Your rod and Your staff, they comfort us. Help us to trust in Your goodness and mercy, even in the face of death, for You have prepared a bright pathway to a new and better life for those who follow You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Needless to say, death for many is a darkened door at the end of life, a passageway to an unknown destiny. But for God's people, death is a bright pathway to a new and better life. So, friends, why do we fear death? Is it fear of pain we expect, the separation from loved ones, or the unknown? God can help us with those fears. He has shown us that death is not final but just another step in the eternal life we received when we follow Him.
subject: Embrace the Eternal Promise
verse_text: The way of the godly leads to life; their path does not lead to death.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who control their tongue will have a long life;_

_a quick retort can rune everything. _(Pro. 13:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

You have not mastered self-control if you do not control

what you say. Words can cut and destroy. James recognized

this truth when he stated, "The tongue is a small thing, but

what enormous damage it can do. (Jm. 3:5) If you want to

be self-controlled, begin with your tongue. Stop and think

before you react or speak.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always remember to put

my brain in gear before putting my tongue in gear. I confess

I often end up with one foot in my mouth. Amen.
original_reflection_text: You have not mastered self-control if you do not control what you say. Words can cut and destroy. James recognized this truth when he stated, "The tongue is a small thing, but what enormous damage it can do. (James 3:5) If you want to be self-controlled, begin with your tongue. Stop and think before you react or speak.
original_verse_text: Those who control their tongue will have a long life; a quick retort can rune everything.
prayer: Gracious Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the power of our words and the need for self-control. Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, as Your servant James has taught us. May our tongues be instruments of life, not death, that we may honor You and build up one another. Guide us to pause and reflect before we react, that our words may be seasoned with wisdom and grace. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: You have not mastered self-control if you do not control what you say. Words can cut and destroy. James recognized this truth when he stated, "The tongue is a small thing, but what enormous damage it can do." (James 3:5) If you want to be self-controlled, begin with your tongue. Stop and think before you react or speak.
subject: Tame Your Tongue, Control Yourself
verse_text: Those who control their tongue will have a long life; a quick retort can rune everything.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Lazy people want much but get little, but those who work_

_hard will prosper and be satisfied. _(Pro. 13:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Pride leads us to conclude that we deserve all we can see, touch, or

imagine. It creates greedy appetites for far more than we need. We

can be released from our self centered desires by humbling ourselves

before God, realizing that all we really need is His approval.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would help me

see that the world's attractions are only cheap substitutes for what

You have to offer. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Pride leads us to conclude that we deserve all we can see, touch, or imagine. It creates greedy appetites for far more than we need. We can be released from our self centered desires by humbling ourselves before God, realizing that all we really need is His approval.
original_verse_text: Lazy people want much but get little, but those who work hard will prosper and be satisfied.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our true worth and satisfaction come not from the things of this world, but from Your love and approval. Help us to cultivate a spirit of selflessness, looking to the interests of others rather than our own. May we find joy in serving You and one another, putting aside our pride and greed. Empower us to walk in the way of Your Son, Jesus, who emptied Himself for our sake. Amen.
reflection: Pride leads us to conclude that we deserve all we can see, touch, or imagine. It creates greedy appetites for far more than we need. We can be released from our self-centered desires by humbling ourselves before God, realizing that all we really need is His approval.
subject: Humble Yourself Before God
verse_text: Lazy people want much but get little, but those who work hard will prosper and be satisfied.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Godliness help people all through life, while the evil are_

_destroyed by their wickedness. _(Pro. 13:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Godly living safeguards your life. Every choice for good sets

into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow

the same pattern, but in the opposite direction. Each decision

you make to obey God's Word will make a greater sense of

order to your life, while each decision to disobey will bring

confusion and destruction. The right choices you make reflect

your integrity. Obedience brings the greatest safeguard and

security.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be obedient to Your

Holy Spirit's leading in my life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Godly living safeguards your life. Every choice for good sets into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow the same pattern, but in the opposite direction. Each decision you make to obey God's Word will make a greater sense of order to your life, while each decision to disobey will bring confusion and destruction. The right choices you make reflect your integrity. Obedience brings the greatest safeguard and security.
original_verse_text: Godliness help people all through life, while the evil are destroyed by their wickedness.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom found in Your Word, which guides us to make choices that safeguard our lives. Help us to walk in the path of righteousness, for You promise to guard the course of the just and protect the way of Your faithful ones. May our decisions reflect the integrity of our hearts, that we may experience the order, security, and blessings that come from obedience to Your commands. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Godly living safeguards your life. Every choice for good sets into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow the same pattern, but in the opposite direction. Each decision you make to obey God's Word will make a greater sense of order to your life, while each decision to disobey will bring confusion and destruction. The right choices you make reflect your integrity. Obedience brings the greatest safeguard and security.
subject: Obedience Brings Safeguard, Security
verse_text: Godliness help people all through life, while the evil are destroyed by their wickedness.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Some who are poor pretend to be rich, others who are rich pretend _

_to be poor. _(Pro. 13:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Let's be honest with ourselves: WHY do we save money? Are we

saving for retirement? Is it to buy more expensive cars or toys? IS

it to be secure? In Lk. 12:18ff Jesus challenges us to think beyond

earthbound goals and to use what we have been given for God's

Kingdom. Faith, service, and obedience are the way to become rich

toward God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I fall into the trap of
worshiping

riches. Help me focus on the eternal riches You have promised to
those

who are faithful to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Let's be honest with ourselves: WHY do we save money? Are we saving for retirement? Is it to buy more expensive cars or toys? IS it to be secure? In Luke 12:18ff Jesus challenges us to think beyond earthbound goals and to use what we have been given for God's Kingdom. Faith, service, and obedience are the way to become rich toward God.
original_verse_text: Some who are poor pretend to be rich, others who are rich pretend to be poor.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to align our priorities with Your will. Forgive us for the times when we have been consumed by the pursuit of earthly treasures, forgetting that true riches are found in serving You and others. Help us to see that security and significance come not from the abundance of our possessions, but from the depth of our relationship with You. May we be rich toward Your Kingdom, using the resources You have entrusted to us for the advancement of Your purposes. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Let's be honest with ourselves: Why do we save money? Are we saving for retirement? Is it to buy more expensive cars or toys? Is it to be secure? In Luke 12:18ff, Jesus challenges us to think beyond earthbound goals and to use what we have been given for God's Kingdom. Faith, service, and obedience are the way to become rich toward God.
subject: Become Rich Toward God
verse_text: Some who are poor pretend to be rich, others who are rich pretend to be poor.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Pride leads to arguments; those who take advice are wise. _

(Pro. 13:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"I was wrong" or "I need advice" are difficult phrases to

otter because they require humility. Pride is an ingredient

in every quarrel. It stirs up conflict and divides people.

Humility, by contrast, heals. Guard against pride. If you

find yourself constantly arguing, examine your life for

pride. be open to the advice of others, ask for help when

you need it, and be willing to admit your mistakes.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I am prideful.

Help me to be more humble, when I need to ask for advice.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: "I was wrong" or "I need advice" are difficult phrases to otter because they require humility. Pride is an ingredient in every quarrel. It stirs up conflict and divides people. Humility, by contrast, heals. Guard against pride. If you find yourself constantly arguing, examine your life for pride. be open to the advice of others, ask for help when you need it, and be willing to admit your mistakes.
original_verse_text: Pride leads to arguments; those who take advice are wise.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that pride is the root of many conflicts and divisions. Forgive us for the times we have let our ego and self-righteousness lead us astray, causing strife and discord. Grant us the wisdom to seek counsel from others, to admit our mistakes, and to approach life with a spirit of humility. May we learn from the wise words of Proverbs, that "with humility comes wisdom," and that pride only "breeds quarrels." Lord, transform our hearts, that we may be peacemakers and instruments of Your healing grace. Amen.
reflection: "I was wrong" or "I need advice" are difficult phrases to utter because they require humility. Pride is an ingredient in every quarrel. It stirs up conflict and divides people. Humility, by contrast, heals. Guard against pride. If you find yourself constantly arguing, examine your life for pride. Be open to the advice of others, ask for help when you need it, and be willing to admit your mistakes.
subject: Overcome Pride, Embrace Humility
verse_text: Pride leads to arguments; those who take advice are wise.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People who advise advice will find themselves in trouble;_

_those who respect it will succeed_. (Pro. 13:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God created us, knows us, and loves us. It only make sense, then

to listen to His instruction, and do what He says. The Bible is His

unfailing word to us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your instruction Book,

I pray that I would always be faithful in applying Your instructions

to my life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God created us, knows us, and loves us. It only make sense, then to listen to His instruction, and do what He says. The Bible is His unfailing word to us.
original_verse_text: People who advise advice will find themselves in trouble; those who respect it will succeed.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your Word is a lamp to our feet and a light to our path. Help us to heed Your instruction, for to despise Your word is to despise You. May we walk in the light of Your truth, ever mindful that You have created us, know us, and love us. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may faithfully follow Your ways. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: God created us, knows us, and loves us. It only makes sense, then, to listen to His instruction and do what He says. The Bible is His unfailing word to us.
subject: Heed God's Unfailing Instruction
verse_text: People who advise advice will find themselves in trouble; those who respect it will succeed.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

A person with good sense is respected; a treacherous person

walks a rocky road. (Pro. 13:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The only way to become truly wise is to fear (revere) God.

This same thought is expressed in (Pro. 1:7-9). to often

people want to skip this step, thinking they can become wise

by life experiences and academic knowledge alone. But if

we do not acknowledge God as the source of wisdom, then

our foundation of making wise decisions is shaky, and we

are prone to mistakes and foolish choices.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always take the advice of the

wise. Help me remember to always think before making any

decisions. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The only way to become truly wise is to fear (revere) God. This same thought is expressed in (Proverbs 1:7-9). to often people want to skip this step, thinking they can become wise by life experiences and academic knowledge alone. But if we do not acknowledge God as the source of wisdom, then our foundation of making wise decisions is shaky, and we are prone to mistakes and foolish choices.
original_verse_text: A person with good sense is respected; a treacherous person walks a rocky road.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. Help us to revere You, the Almighty God, as the source of all true knowledge and understanding. May we not rely on our own limited understanding, but seek Your guidance and wisdom in all our ways. Grant us discernment to make wise choices that glorify Your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The only way to become truly wise is to fear (revere) God. This same thought is expressed in (Proverbs 1:7-9). Too often, people want to skip this step, thinking they can become wise by life experiences and academic knowledge alone. But if we do not acknowledge God as the source of wisdom, then our foundation of making wise decisions is shaky, and we are prone to mistakes and foolish choices.
subject: Wisdom Begins with Reverence
verse_text: A person with good sense is respected; a treacherous person walks a rocky road.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Wise people think before they act; fools don't and even brag_

_about it. _(Pro. 13:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_Wise people don't have to prove anything. Beware of showing_

_off. If you are modest, people may not notice at first, but they_

_will respect you later._

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would not think that I

have to prove anything, but merely live according to Your

Spirit's guidance. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Wise people don't have to prove anything. Beware of showing off. If you are modest, people may not notice at first, but they will respect you later.
original_verse_text: Wise people think before they act; fools don't and even brag about it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true wisdom is found in Your Word. Help us to be people of understanding, not seeking to exalt ourselves, but to walk in the path of humility and grace. May we not be tempted by the allure of pride, but instead, find our worth in Your steadfast love. Guide us to live with modesty and integrity, that we may earn the respect of others through the testimony of our lives. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Wise people don't have to prove anything. Beware of showing off. If you are modest, people may not notice at first, but they will respect you later.
subject: Modesty Earns Lasting Respect
verse_text: Wise people think before they act; fools don't and even brag about it.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you ignore criticism, you will end up in poverty and disgrace; _

_if you accept criticism you will be honored. _(Pro. 13:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It has been said that, if you listen to corrective criticism you will
be

at home with the wise. If you reject criticism you are only harming

yourself.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray for humility, so that if I receive
criticism

I will accept it a grow from it. Amen.

Ps. The reason you did not receive a devo. on Father's day is that my

computer started doing it's own thing and my daughter have to
straighten

it out. GOD BLESS HAVE A GOOD WEEK.
original_reflection_text: It has been said that, if you listen to corrective criticism you will be at home with the wise. If you reject criticism you are only harming yourself.
original_verse_text: If you ignore criticism, you will end up in poverty and disgrace; if you accept criticism you will be honored.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking wisdom and understanding. Help us to have ears that are attentive to the words of the wise, that we may grow in knowledge and discernment. Grant us the humility to receive correction, for it is through this that we find the path to true life. May we not be stubborn or prideful, but open to the guidance of Your Word and the counsel of those who walk closely with You. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: It has been said that if you listen to corrective criticism, you will be at home with the wise. If you reject criticism, you are only harming yourself.
subject: Embrace Corrective Criticism, Grow Wise
verse_text: If you ignore criticism, you will end up in poverty and disgrace; if you accept criticism you will be honored.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is pleasant to see dreams come true, but fools will not turn from
evil _

_to attain them. _(Pro. 13:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Whether a "dream come true" is good or bad depending on the nature

of the dream or desire. It is pleasant to achieve worthwhile goals,
but

all goals are not worth pursuing. When you set your heart on
something,

you may loose your ability to assess it objectively. With your desire

blinding your judgment, you may proceed with an unwise relationship,

a wasteful purchase, or a poorly conceived plan. Faithfulness is a
virtue,

but stubbornness is not.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I would follow Your Holy Spirit's

guidance in this life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Whether a "dream come true" is good or bad depending on the nature of the dream or desire. It is pleasant to achieve worthwhile goals, but all goals are not worth pursuing. When you set your heart on something, you may loose your ability to assess it objectively. With your desire blinding your judgment, you may proceed with an unwise relationship, a wasteful purchase, or a poorly conceived plan. Faithfulness is a virtue, but stubbornness is not.
original_verse_text: It is pleasant to see dreams come true, but fools will not turn from evil to attain them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that the ways of this world may seem right, but can lead to destruction. Help us to discern Your will and align our desires with Your perfect plan. Grant us the wisdom to pursue only those dreams and goals that are pleasing in Your sight, that we may not be blinded by our own selfish ambitions. May our faithfulness be rooted in Your truth, not in stubborn pride. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk the path of righteousness. Amen.
reflection: Whether a "dream come true" is good or bad, depending on the nature of the dream or desire. It is pleasant to achieve worthwhile goals, but all goals are not worth pursuing. When you set your heart on something, you may lose your ability to assess it objectively. With your desire blinding your judgment, you may proceed with an unwise relationship, a wasteful purchase, or a poorly conceived plan. Faithfulness is a virtue, but stubbornness is not.
subject: Discern Worthy Dreams Carefully
verse_text: It is pleasant to see dreams come true, but fools will not turn from evil to attain them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Whoever walks with the wise will become wise; whoever

walks with fools will suffer harm. (Pro. 13:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The old saying "A rotten apple spoils the whole barrel" is

often applied to friendships, and with good reason. our

friends and associates affect us, sometimes profoundly.

We need to be careful who we choose as our closest friends.

We need to spend time with people who we would like to be

like, because we and our friends will surely grow to resemble

each other.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be more Christ-like in my

walk through life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The old saying "A rotten apple spoils the whole barrel" is often applied to friendships, and with good reason. our friends and associates affect us, sometimes profoundly. We need to be careful who we choose as our closest friends. We need to spend time with people who we would like to be like, because we and our friends will surely grow to resemble each other.
original_verse_text: Whoever walks with the wise will become wise; whoever walks with fools will suffer harm.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the wisdom found in Your Word, which reminds us that the company we keep shapes who we become. Grant us discernment to surround ourselves with those who will sharpen and strengthen our faith, that we may grow in godliness and reflect Your light to the world. May our friendships be a source of mutual encouragement, iron sharpening iron, to the glory of Your name. Amen.
reflection: The old saying "A rotten apple spoils the whole barrel" is often applied to friendships, and with good reason. Our friends and associates affect us, sometimes profoundly. We need to be careful who we choose as our closest friends. We need to spend time with people who we would like to be like, because we and our friends will surely grow to resemble each other.
subject: Choosing Wise Friends Wisely
verse_text: Whoever walks with the wise will become wise; whoever walks with fools will suffer harm.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Trouble chases sinners, while blessings chase the righteous! _

(Pro. 13 20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

All will be well for those who are godly. Tell them, "You will

receive a wonderful reward." But we need to remind the wicked,

"Your destruction is sure. You surely will get what you deserve.

Your well earned punishment is on the way."

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, give me the guidance to use godly wisdom when

warnings to those who have gone astray, and need godly

guidance. Amen.
original_reflection_text: All will be well for those who are godly. Tell them, "You will receive a wonderful reward. " But we need to remind the wicked, "Your destruction is sure. You surely will get what you deserve. Your well earned punishment is on the way. "
original_verse_text: Trouble chases sinners, while blessings chase the righteous!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You are faithful to those who walk uprightly and love Your name. Your promise of protection and eternal inheritance for the righteous fills us with hope. Yet, we acknowledge the reality of Your just judgment upon the wicked, who will reap the consequences of their sin. Grant us wisdom to live according to Your ways, that we may dwell in the land and enjoy Your blessings forever. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: All will be well for those who are godly. Tell them, "You will receive a wonderful reward." But we need to remind the wicked, "Your destruction is sure. You surely will get what you deserve. Your well-earned punishment is on the way."
subject: Godly Rewarded, Wicked Punished
verse_text: Trouble chases sinners, while blessings chase the righteous!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A poor person's farm may produce much food, but injustice _

_sweeps it all away. _(Pro. 13:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The poor are often victims of an unjust society. A poor man's soil

may be good but unjust laws may rob him of his own produce.

This proverb does not take poverty lightly or wink at injustice, it

simply describes what often occurs. We should do what we can to

fight injustice of every sort. Our efforts may seem inadequate, but

it is comforting to know that in the end God's justice will prevail.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father of all grace and mercy, I thank you that in the

end of this life, Your justice will prevail. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The poor are often victims of an unjust society. A poor man's soil may be good but unjust laws may rob him of his own produce. This proverb does not take poverty lightly or wink at injustice, it simply describes what often occurs. We should do what we can to fight injustice of every sort. Our efforts may seem inadequate, but it is comforting to know that in the end God's justice will prevail.
original_verse_text: A poor person's farm may produce much food, but injustice sweeps it all away.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with heavy hearts, for we see the injustice that plagues the lives of the poor. Your Word reminds us that the righteous care for the needs of the poor, yet so often, they are robbed of the fruits of their labor. Lord, open our eyes to the plight of the marginalized, and stir our hearts to seek justice and defend the oppressed. Grant us the wisdom and courage to be agents of change, that Your perfect justice may reign. We trust in Your sovereign plan, for You are the ultimate Judge who will right every wrong. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The poor are often victims of an unjust society. A poor man's soil may be good, but unjust laws may rob him of his own produce. This proverb does not take poverty lightly or wink at injustice; it simply describes what often occurs. We should do what we can to fight injustice of every sort. Our efforts may seem inadequate, but it is comforting to know that in the end, God's justice will prevail.
subject: Overcoming Unjust Societal Structures
verse_text: A poor person's farm may produce much food, but injustice sweeps it all away.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you refuse to discipline your children, it proves you don't love
them; _

_If you love your children, you will promptly discipline them. _(Pro.
13:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is not easy for a loving parent to discipline a child, but it is
necessary.

The greatest responsibility God gives parents is the nurturing and
guidance

of their children. Lack of discipline puts parents love in question
because

it shows a lack of concern for the character development of their
children.

Disciplining children averts long range disaster. Without correction,
children

grow up with no clear understanding of right and wrong.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, please remind us that we have been given a
great

blessing, but also a great responsibility in disciplining our
children. In

that responsibility our children will learn to become good parents. .
. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It is not easy for a loving parent to discipline a child, but it is necessary. The greatest responsibility God gives parents is the nurturing and guidance of their children. Lack of discipline puts parents love in question because it shows a lack of concern for the character development of their children. Disciplining children averts long range disaster. Without correction, children grow up with no clear understanding of right and wrong.
original_verse_text: If you refuse to discipline your children, it proves you don't love them; If you love your children, you will promptly discipline them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of children and the responsibility You have entrusted to us as parents. Help us to faithfully train up our children in the way they should go, disciplining them with love and wisdom, that they may grow in godly character and understanding. May our discipline reflect the depth of our care, that our children would know the security of Your love. We ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: It is not easy for a loving parent to discipline a child, but it is necessary. The greatest responsibility God gives parents is the nurturing and guidance of their children. Lack of discipline puts parents love in question because it shows a lack of concern for the character development of their children. Disciplining children averts long range disaster. Without correction, children grow up with no clear understanding of right and wrong.
subject: Discipline Reflects Parental Love
verse_text: If you refuse to discipline your children, it proves you don't love them; If you love your children, you will promptly discipline them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The godly eat to their heart's content, but the belly of the wicked
_

_goes hungry. _(Pro. 13:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Even strong young lions sometimes go hungry, but those who trust

in the Lord will never lack any GOOD thing.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for knowing what I need, I pray that

Your Holy Spirit would remind me daily, that my greatest needs

are spiritual. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Even strong young lions sometimes go hungry, but those who trust in the Lord will never lack any GOOD thing.
original_verse_text: The godly eat to their heart's content, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You are the provider of all good things. Like the young lions, we too may face times of want and hunger, but we trust in Your unfailing love and provision. Lord, help us to seek You first, to rely on Your wisdom and strength, and to find our true satisfaction in You alone. May we never lack any good thing, for You are the source of all blessings. Amen.
reflection: Even strong young lions sometimes go hungry, but those who trust in the Lord will never lack any good thing.
subject: Trusting God Provides All Good
verse_text: The godly eat to their heart's content, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who follow the right path fear the Lord; those who take the_

_wrong path despise Him._ (Pro. 14:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I believe what we should recognize is a call for Christian maturity.

Christian maturity means making Christ the being and ending of

our faith. To grow in maturity we must center our lives on Christ.

not depending on some religious ritual, not falling back into sin,

or trusting in ourselves, and not letting anything come between us

and Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would keep me always

focused on You. Keep me from becoming prideful, so that I will

not let any material thing come between myself and You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: I believe what we should recognize is a call for Christian maturity. Christian maturity means making Christ the being and ending of our faith. To grow in maturity we must center our lives on Christ. not depending on some religious ritual, not falling back into sin, or trusting in ourselves, and not letting anything come between us and Christ.
original_verse_text: Those who follow the right path fear the Lord; those who take the wrong path despise Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to grow in Christian maturity. Help us to center our lives on Christ, the true foundation of our faith. May we not depend on empty rituals or worldly wisdom, but instead, speak the truth in love, that we may grow up in all things into Him who is the head, even Christ. Guide us to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which we have been called, that we may be built up in You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: I believe what we should recognize is a call for Christian maturity. Christian maturity means making Christ the being and end of our faith. To grow in maturity, we must center our lives on Christ, not depending on some religious ritual, not falling back into sin, or trusting in ourselves, and not letting anything come between us and Christ.
subject: Cultivate Christ-Centered Maturity
verse_text: Those who follow the right path fear the Lord; those who take the wrong path despise Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_An empty stable stays clean, but no income comes from an empty_

_stable._ (Pro. 14:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When a farmer has no cattle, the stable will be clean, but he will

be unable to make a living. The only way to keep your life clean

of people problems, is to keep it free from of people. But if your

life is empty of people, it is useless, and if you live only for
yourself, your life loses its meaning. Instead of avoiding people, we

should serve others, share our faith, and work for justice. Is your

life free but empty? Or does it give evidence of your serving God

wholeheartedly.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, help me to be a truthful witness in all that

I say and do. May my words always be words of praise in Your

name. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: When a farmer has no cattle, the stable will be clean, but he will be unable to make a living. The only way to keep your life clean of people problems, is to keep it free from of people. But if your life is empty of people, it is useless, and if you live only for yourself, your life loses its meaning. Instead of avoiding people, we should serve others, share our faith, and work for justice. Is your life free but empty? Or does it give evidence of your serving God wholeheartedly.
original_verse_text: An empty stable stays clean, but no income comes from an empty stable.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom found in Your Word. Help us to see that a life free from people is a life that loses its purpose. May we not avoid the messiness of relationships, but instead embrace the opportunity to serve others, share Your love, and work for justice. Guide us to live wholeheartedly for You, not selfishly for ourselves. May our lives bear fruit and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: When a farmer has no cattle, the stable will be clean, but he will be unable to make a living. The only way to keep your life clean of people problems is to keep it free from people. But if your life is empty of people, it is useless, and if you live only for yourself, your life loses its meaning. Instead of avoiding people, we should serve others, share our faith, and work for justice. Is your life free but empty? Or does it give evidence of your serving God wholeheartedly?
subject: Serve Others, Share Faith, Seek Justice
verse_text: An empty stable stays clean, but no income comes from an empty stable.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A truthful witness does not lie, a falls witness breaths lies.
_(Pro. 14:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Lies just seem to pour out of some people, and what happens is that

it sow discord among many in the congregation. God warns us against

deception. Even though deception is a way of life for many people,

God's people must not give into it.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would bridle my tongue when

I am tempted to share a half truth. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Lies just seem to pour out of some people, and what happens is that it sow discord among many in the congregation. God warns us against deception. Even though deception is a way of life for many people, God's people must not give into it.
original_verse_text: A truthful witness does not lie, a falls witness breaths lies.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the temptation to speak deceitfully that so often plagues us. Help us to be people of truth, whose words and actions reflect the integrity You desire. Grant us the wisdom to recognize falsehood and the courage to stand firm in Your truth, that we may build up Your church and bring glory to Your name. May our lips be found faithful, as You have instructed in Your Word. Amen.
reflection: Lies just seem to pour out of some people, and what happens is that it sows discord among many in the congregation. God warns us against deception. Even though deception is a way of life for many people, God's people must not give in to it.
subject: Beware Deception's Corrosive Power
verse_text: A truthful witness does not lie, a falls witness breaths lies.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Mockers seek wisdom but never find it, but knowledge comes easily_

_to those with understanding. _(Pro. 14:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We all know mockers, (people who seem to have nothing better to do

but ridicule people who have done a little bit better then
themselves.)

The reason they do not find wisdom is they do not seek it seriously.

Wisdom comes to those who apply God's Word to their lives and seek

out godly counselors. If the wisdom you seek does not come easily to

you perhaps your attitude is the barrier.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my attitude would never become a

barrier in my ability to learn more about You. I pray that there
would

be an earnest effort in our country to draw closer to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We all know mockers, (people who seem to have nothing better to do but ridicule people who have done a little bit better then themselves. ) The reason they do not find wisdom is they do not seek it seriously. Wisdom comes to those who apply God's Word to their lives and seek out godly counselors. If the wisdom you seek does not come easily to you perhaps your attitude is the barrier.
original_verse_text: Mockers seek wisdom but never find it, but knowledge comes easily to those with understanding.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that true wisdom is a gift from You. Help us to seek after Your wisdom with sincere hearts, not with the mocking attitude of those who scoff at Your ways. May we diligently apply Your Word to our lives and humbly seek the counsel of those who walk closely with You. Remove any barriers in our hearts that prevent us from finding the wisdom that comes from above. Grant us the understanding and discernment to live according to Your will. Amen.
reflection: We all know mockers (people who seem to have nothing better to do but ridicule people who have done a little bit better than themselves). The reason they do not find wisdom is they do not seek it seriously. Wisdom comes to those who apply God's Word to their lives and seek out godly counselors. If the wisdom you seek does not come easily to you, perhaps your attitude is the barrier.
subject: Overcome Mockers with Wisdom
verse_text: Mockers seek wisdom but never find it, but knowledge comes easily to those with understanding.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you plot evil, you will be lost, but if you plan good, you will
be _

_granted love and faithfulness. _(Pro. 14:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Don't be miss led. Remember you can't ignore God and get away

with it.It's a natural law you will always reap what you sow. Every

action has results.The Holy Spirit is in constant opposition to our

sinful desires.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be sensitive and obedient to

Your Holy Spirit's guidance in my life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Don't be miss led. Remember you can't ignore God and get away with it. It's a natural law you will always reap what you sow. Every action has results. The Holy Spirit is in constant opposition to our sinful desires.
original_verse_text: If you plot evil, you will be lost, but if you plan good, you will be granted love and faithfulness.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that we cannot ignore Your divine laws and expect to escape the consequences. Help us to be mindful that we will always reap what we sow, for our actions have eternal results. Grant us the wisdom to walk in the Spirit, resisting the temptations of our sinful nature, that we may bear the fruit of righteousness and glorify Your name. May we never be deceived, but instead, seek to honor You in all that we do. Amen.
reflection: Don't be miss led. Remember you can't ignore God and get away with it. It's a natural law you will always reap what you sow. Every action has results. The Holy Spirit is in constant opposition to our sinful desires.
subject: Reap What You Sow
verse_text: If you plot evil, you will be lost, but if you plan good, you will be granted love and faithfulness.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Those who fear the Lord are secure; he will be a place of refuge_

_for his children. _(Pro. 14:26)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Even in our troubled world those who live in the fear of the Lord,

usually results in obvious blessings--but not always. Sometimes

sin intervenes, and some blessings must be delayed until Jesus

returns to establish His eternal kingdom. that's why we must live

by faith not seeing (2 Cor. 5:7)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a faith such as Paul had,
trusting

in You while waiting for Your promises. Amen
original_reflection_text: Even in our troubled world those who live in the fear of the Lord, usually results in obvious blessings--but not always. Sometimes sin intervenes, and some blessings must be delayed until Jesus returns to establish His eternal kingdom. that's why we must live by faith not seeing (2 Corinthians 5:7)
original_verse_text: Those who fear the Lord are secure; he will be a place of refuge for his children.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true security and hope are found in the fear of the Lord. Even in the midst of a troubled world, we trust in Your promises and the unseen blessings that come through living by faith. Grant us the strength to persevere, to walk in Your ways, and to eagerly await the day when Your eternal kingdom is fully realized. May our lives be a testament to the power of faith, as we fix our eyes on the unseen and eternal. Amen.
reflection: Even in our troubled world those who live in the fear of the Lord, usually results in obvious blessings--but not always. Sometimes sin intervenes, and some blessings must be delayed until Jesus returns to establish His eternal kingdom. that's why we must live by faith not seeing (2 Corinthians 5:7)
subject: Blessings Delayed Until Christ's Return
verse_text: Those who fear the Lord are secure; he will be a place of refuge for his children.
